item.title: Report E-2024050335
item.description:
Report E-2024050335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: TEMPLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon glass bottles of UN1789 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel wiped down the impacted pallet with absorbent pads and containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050342
item.description:
Report E-2024050342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KILGORE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, at 1105 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Kilgore, Texas regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Muriatic acid (Hydrochloric acid solution, UN1789, 8, II). The release was reportedly due to a load shift and was contained to the trailer floor. Contractors cleaned up the release was absorbents, neutralizer and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and one (1) 95-gallon metal drum. All waste generated was staged onsite pending the shipper's disposition and pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050305
item.description:
Report E-2024050305

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 7, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of ink was punctured and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the drum's surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. Crews observed the release only impacted the drum itself and the material had already dried. ES&H personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum to be staged onsite for further evaluation.

item.title: Report E-2024050288
item.description:
Report E-2024050288

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN1263 RailPlex 2.0 Alkyd Primer release from (5) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to a 10’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a loading strap bending the pails. The damaged pails were collected into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted area and then collected along with the broken pallet pieces into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024050625
item.description:
Report X-2024050625

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on a cart wrapped in a plastic bag just outside of the Hazmat cage. Box had a small wet torn spot near the bottom. Upon inspection, all 4 bottles felt full and no active leakage was observed when they were turned over. 1 had a very small wet spot near the cap that tested as pH 12-13.

item.title: Report E-2024050265
item.description:
Report E-2024050265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 275-gallon tote containing hazardous product, FlexPro® CL5694. This resulted in 1-cup of release of product onto the plastic tote and the metal cage. The puncture is from a sharp or protruding object. A Contractor performed a tote transfer and cleaned-up the release. One drum of waste was generated for the cut-up tote and impacted absorbents pads. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
